products.name: Raw Cocoa Butter
products.description: Raw Cocoa Butter is the natural fat extracted from cocoa beans during processing of cocoa mass. It is unrefined and non-deodorized, preserving its characteristic cocoa aroma. Rich in saturated fats and antioxidants, it's used extensively in premium chocolate production, cosmetics, and nutraceutical formulations.

properties.value: Pale yellow, brittle solid at room temperature

safety_and_hazard.value: Not hazardous
Non-allergenic but produced from cocoa
Within global food safety limits
Conforms to EU/FDA norms

applications.value: Used as the main fat in dark, milk, and white chocolates.
Applied in fillings, coatings, and premium baked goods.
Used in functional foods for its antioxidant and healthy fat profile.
Forms the base of lip balms, moisturizers, and body butters for its emollient properties.

storage.value: Cool, dry place (below 25°C), avoid heat and direct light
2 pallets high (for cartons or blocks)
Palletized, stretch-wrapped, containerized
25 kg blocks, 5 kg slabs, or bulk cartons

highlights: Suitability: Organic skincare, Nutraceutical, Artisan bakers, Food formulators

faq.key: What is the melting point of raw cocoa butter?
faq.value: Typically 34–38°C, allowing smooth melt-in-mouth properties in chocolates.

faq.key: Is this cocoa butter deodorized?
faq.value: No, it retains its natural cocoa aroma—ideal for flavor-rich and natural cosmetic applications.

faq.key: Can cocoa butter be used in organic formulations?
faq.value: Yes, it is certified organic when sourced accordingly.

faq.key: How is cocoa butter stored and handled?
faq.value: Keep in a cool, dry place below 25°C; avoid direct sunlight and high humidity.

faq.key: What is the typical fatty acid profile?
faq.value: Rich in stearic (~35%), palmitic (~25%), oleic (~35%) acids.

faq.key: Is this product suitable for both food and cosmetic use?
faq.value: Yes, compliant for dual-use with appropriate certification.

faq.key: What is your assay?
faq.value: Free Fatty Acids ≤ 1.5%, Peroxide Value ≤ 5 meq/kg

faq.key: What documents are included?
faq.value: COA, Organic Certificate (if applicable), MSDS, Pesticide Report

products.name: Raw cocoa mass
products.description: Raw Cocoa Mass is produced by grinding roasted or raw cocoa nibs into a rich, aromatic paste that solidifies at room temperature. It contains both cocoa solids and cocoa butter in natural proportions and is the foundational ingredient for dark chocolate, confections, and nutraceutical cocoa products. It is also called Cocoa Liquor.

safety_and_hazard.value: Not hazardous
Contains cocoa (potential allergen for sensitive individuals)
Below EU/US limits (Cd, Pb, Hg)
Compliant with Codex and EU norms

applications.value: Base material for dark, milk, and couverture chocolate production.
Used for high-flavanol health products, cocoa-based supplements, and beverages.
Incorporated in premium baked goods, truffles, and fillings.
Occasionally used in lip balms and body butters for aroma and skin feel.

storage.value: Cool, dry area (≤ 20°C), away from odors and moisture
2 pallets high (blocks); boxed units for buttons
Palletized, stretch-wrapped, containerized
5 kg blocks, 25 kg cartons, or 1000 kg totes

highlights: Suitable: Artisan confectioner, Vegan, Raw Food

faq.key: What is the fat content in raw cocoa mass?
faq.value: Typically 52–55%, naturally derived from cocoa butter within the nibs.

faq.key: Is raw cocoa mass suitable for organic chocolate production?
faq.value: Yes, when sourced from certified organic farms and processed accordingly.

faq.key: How is raw cocoa mass different from processed cocoa liquor?
faq.value: Raw cocoa mass is unrefined and non-alkalized, preserving higher antioxidant levels and original flavor.

faq.key: Can this be used in nutraceutical formulations?
faq.value: Yes, it’s high in flavanols and used in health supplements and functional drinks.

faq.key: What is the typical packaging format?
faq.value: Supplied in 5 kg blocks, 25 kg cartons, or bulk totes, depending on buyer requirements.

faq.key: What is your assay?
faq.value: Cocoa Butter 52–55%, Moisture ≤ 1.5%, pH 5.2–6.0

faq.key: What are your payment terms?
faq.value: 30–50% advance, balance on dispatch (standard)

faq.key: Is this product allergen-free?
faq.value: Cocoa is considered a potential allergen; produced in allergen-controlled facilities.

faq.key: What documents are included?
faq.value: COA, Organic Certificate, Pesticide Residue Report, MSDS

products.name: Blood Meal Supplement (Agriculture Grade)
products.description: Blood Meal is a dry, sterilized animal byproduct rich in nitrogen, used as an organic soil amendment and fertilizer. It provides rapid nitrogen uptake and improves soil organic matter, commonly applied in organic farming, horticulture, and nitrogen-deficient soil zones.

safety_and_hazard.value: Not classified as hazardous

P280: Use gloves and dust mask when applying

P261: Avoid breathing dust

P264: Wash after use

P305+P351+P338: In case of eye exposure, rinse thoroughly

applications.value: Fast-acting organic nitrogen for leafy vegetables, cereals, and lawn crops.
Enhances microbial activity and organic content in soil ecosystems.
Used in blending with compost, potting soils, or biofertilizer carriers.
Supplies nitrogen to accelerate carbon-heavy compost piles.
Greenhouse and protected cultivation systems
Supplied in bulk to agricultural cooperatives and horticulture hubs

storage.value: Cool, dry place, away from moisture and pests
2–3 bags high on pallets
12 months (dry sealed conditions)
Dried, sterilized animal blood in powder or granule form
Palletized, stretch-wrapped, containerized

highlights: Compliant:  FCO (India), OMRI / USDA-NOP, EU Fertilizer Regulation (2019/1009)

faq.key: What is the nitrogen percentage in blood meal?
faq.value: Blood meal provides 12–15% nitrogen—making it one of the most concentrated organic nitrogen sources.

faq.key: How is it typically applied in the field?
faq.value: Applied as a basal dose or side dressing; can be blended with compost or spread directly into soil.

faq.key: Is this product suitable for certified organic farming?
faq.value: Yes, when sourced from approved slaughter facilities and with proper documentation (OMRI/USDA-NOP compliant).

faq.key: Does blood meal have any effect on soil health?
faq.value: Yes, it promotes microbial activity, supports vegetative growth, and improves soil fertility.

faq.key: Is it suitable for all crops?
faq.value: Best for nitrogen-hungry crops like leafy vegetables, corn, rice, and turf; not ideal for fruiting crops at maturity stages.

faq.key: What is the shelf life and how should it be stored?
faq.value: Up to 12 months in dry, ventilated spaces. Seal bags tightly to prevent odor loss and pest attraction.

faq.key: What documentation is included with shipment?
faq.value: COA, MSDS, Phytosanitary certificate (if needed), and organic certification on request.

faq.key: Is blood meal soluble or usable in foliar sprays?
faq.value: No, it is not water-soluble and must be used as a soil amendment only.

faq.key: Can you export to organic-regulated markets?
faq.value: Yes, with COO and process documentation.

faq.key: Who are the general beneficiaries?
faq.value: Supplied in bulk to agricultural cooperatives and horticulture hubs

products.name: Meat Bone Meal Supplement (Agriculture Grade)
products.description: Meat Bone Meal (MBM) is a nutrient-dense organic fertilizer derived from rendered animal bones and tissues. It is sterilized via heat and pressure and ground into a fine meal. Used primarily for phosphorus and calcium enrichment, it supports flowering, fruiting, and root development in soil health programs.

safety_and_hazard.value: Not classified as hazardous

P280: Use gloves, mask, and goggles during application

P261: Avoid inhalation of dust

P264: Wash thoroughly after handling

P305+P351+P338: In case of contact with eyes, rinse cautiously

applications.value: Supplies long-lasting phosphorus and calcium to support flowering, rooting, and fruit development.
Enhances microbial decomposition and nutrient retention in organic compost formulations.
Applied before or at planting to improve nutrient balance and early plant establishment.
Used in horticulture and agroforestry for phosphorus-deficient soils.
Widely in organic farming, greenhouse vegetable cultivation, and orchard systems

6–12 months (sealed)
Rendered, defatted, steam-treated animal meal (bone + soft tissue)
25 kg HDPE bags or 1000 kg jumbo sacks; inner liner available
2 bags high (on pallets)
Palletized, stretch-wrapped, containerized

highlights: Sustainable on phosphorus input restricted zone
Compliant: FCO (India) , OMRI / USDA-NOP , EU Fertilizer Regulation (2019/1009)

faq.key: What is the typical nutrient breakdown in meat bone meal?
faq.value: It contains 4–6% nitrogen, 12–15% phosphorus (P₂O₅), and 15–25% calcium—ideal for flowering crops and fruiting trees.

faq.key: How is it different from plain bone meal?
faq.value: MBM includes both bone and soft tissue, making it richer in nitrogen and slightly faster acting.

faq.key: Can this product be used in certified organic farming?
faq.value: Yes, with appropriate documentation, MBM qualifies under USDA-NOP, OMRI, and EU organic frameworks.

faq.key: How should MBM be applied in the field?
faq.value: Applied at 200–500 kg/ha depending on soil test results, either as a basal fertilizer or mixed into compost.

faq.key: Is it compatible with microbial or biofertilizer blends?
faq.value: Yes, it pairs well with composts, manures, and microbial formulations without degrading activity.

faq.key: What is the Lead Time?
faq.value: 2–4 weeks standard, depending on volume.

faq.key: What documents are provided?
faq.value: COA, MSDS, COO Organic Input Certificate (on request).

faq.key: Is this product heat-treated or sterilized?
faq.value: Yes, it undergoes high-pressure sterilization to ensure biosecurity compliance.

It is widely used as a soil amendment and base fertilizer to promote plant growth, improve soil microbiota, and supply slow-release nutrients in sustainable agriculture.

faq.value: Protein content typically ranges from 55–65%, with nitrogen content of 8–10%, making it a strong organic nitrogen source.

faq.key: Is fish meal suitable for organic farming?
faq.value: Yes, when certified, it complies with OMRI, USDA-NOP, and EU organic input standards.

faq.key: How is fish meal applied in the field?
faq.value: Broadcast at 200–500 kg/ha or mixed with compost or soil amendments. Suitable for basal application or during transplanting.

faq.key: Does it have any odor or stability concerns?
faq.value: Has a strong fishy odor. Store in well-ventilated areas; dry and pest-protected packaging recommended.

products.name: Desvenlafaxine Succinate
products.description: Desvenlafaxine Succinate is a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder (MDD) in adults. It is the active metabolite of venlafaxine, another antidepressant, and works by increasing the levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, which helps regulate mood. It is a metabolite of the drug venlafaxine. It has a role as a marine xenobiotic metabolite, a drug metabolite and an antidepressant.

safety_and_hazard.value:
H315: Causes skin irritation.

H319: Causes serious eye irritation.

H335: May cause respiratory irritation.

P261: Avoid breathing dust/fume/gas/mist/vapors/spray.

P264: Wash hands thoroughly after handling.

P271: Use only outdoors or in a well-ventilated area.

P280: Wear protective gloves/eye protection/face protection.

P302+P352: IF ON SKIN: Wash with plenty of soap and water.

P304+P340: IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing.

P305+P351+P338: IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing.

P312: Call a POISON CENTER or doctor if you feel unwell.

P321: Specific treatment (see on this label).

P332+P313: If skin irritation occurs: Get medical advice/attention.

P337+P313: If eye irritation persists: Get medical advice/attention.

P362: Take off contaminated clothing and wash before reuse.

P403+P233: Store in a well-ventilated place. Keep container tightly closed.

P405: Store locked up.

P501: Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local/regional/national/international regulations.

applications.value: Desvenlafaxine Succinate is prescribed for the treatment of MDD in adults. It helps alleviate symptoms such as persistent feelings of sadness, loss of interest in daily activities, and fatigue.
Incorporated into oral dosage forms, specifically extended-release tablets, to ensure consistent delivery of the medication over time. Common strengths include 25 mg, 50 mg, and 100 mg tablets.

storage.value: Store in a cool, dry place, away from incompatible substances. Keep container tightly closed when not in use.
Available in various sizes, including 25 mg, 50 mg, and 100 mg vials, suitable for both research and pharmaceutical applications.

highlights: (FDA) Approved for major depressive disorder in adults
EU approved in Spain (2012) and Germany (2022)

faq.key: What is Desvenlafaxine Succinate used for?
faq.value: Desvenlafaxine Succinate is primarily used to treat major depressive disorder (MDD) in adults by increasing the levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, which helps regulate mood.

faq.key: How should Desvenlafaxine Succinate be taken?
faq.value: It is typically taken once daily, with or without food. The tablets should be swallowed whole and not divided, crushed, chewed, or dissolved.

faq.key: Are there any serious side effects associated with Desvenlafaxine Succinate?
faq.value: Common side effects include nausea, dizziness, and dry mouth. Serious side effects may include increased blood pressure, suicidal thoughts, and serotonin syndrome. Always consult your healthcare provider if you experience any unusual symptoms. Sexual dysfunction: Including decreased libido and difficulty achieving orgasm.

faq.key: What is the mechanism of action of Desvenlafaxine Succinate?
faq.value: Desvenlafaxine Succinate is a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) that works by inhibiting the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, thus increasing their concentrations and helping to regulate mood.

faq.key: What are the key regulatory requirements for Desvenlafaxine Succinate?
faq.value: Desvenlafaxine Succinate is approved by regulatory bodies such as the FDA for major depressive disorder in adults. It complies with cGMP standards for pharmaceutical manufacturing and is supported by DMF submissions for global markets.

products.name: Fosfomycin Trometamol
products.description: Fosfomycin Trometamol is a broad-spectrum antibiotic used primarily in the treatment of urinary tract infections (UTIs). It functions by inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis, leading to cell lysis and death. The trometamol (tris(hydroxymethyl)aminomethane) salt form enhances its solubility and absorption when administered orally.

safety_and_hazard.value:
H315: Causes skin irritation.
H319: Causes serious eye irritation.
H335: May cause respiratory irritation.

P261: Avoid breathing dust/fume/gas/mist/vapors/spray.

P264: Wash hands thoroughly after handling.

P271: Use only outdoors or in a well-ventilated area.

P280: Wear protective gloves/eye protection/face protection.

P302+P352: IF ON SKIN: Wash with plenty of soap and water.

P304+P340: IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing.

P305+P351+P338: IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing.

P312: Call a POISON CENTER or doctor if you feel unwell.

P321: Specific treatment (see on this label).

P332+P313: If skin irritation occurs: Get medical advice/attention.

P337+P313: If eye irritation persists: Get medical advice/attention.

P362: Take off contaminated clothing and wash before reuse.

P403+P233: Store in a well-ventilated place. Keep container tightly closed.

P405: Store locked up.

P501: Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local/regional/national/international regulations.

applications.value: Fosfomycin Trometamol is commonly prescribed for the treatment of uncomplicated UTIs, offering a single-dose therapy option due to its efficacy and favorable pharmacokinetic properties. Active against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

storage.value: Store in a cool, dry place, away from incompatible substances. Keep container tightly closed when not in use.
Available in various sizes, including 25 mg, 50 mg, and 100 mg vials, suitable for both research and pharmaceutical applications.

highlights: Active against : Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria

faq.key: What is the recommended dosage for Fosfomycin Trometamol in treating urinary tract infections?
faq.value: The typical dosage for Fosfomycin Trometamol in treating uncomplicated urinary tract infections (UTIs) in adults is 3g as a single dose. However, the exact dosage may vary based on the patient's medical history and the severity of the infection.

faq.key: How does Fosfomycin work in the treatment of UTIs?
faq.value: Fosfomycin inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis by blocking the enzyme MurA, which is essential for the formation of the bacterial cell wall. This results in bacterial lysis and effectively treats UTIs caused by susceptible organisms.

faq.key: Can Fosfomycin Trometamol be used in combination with other antibiotics for treating resistant UTIs?
faq.value: Yes, Fosfomycin Trometamol is often used in combination with other antibiotics for treating multi-drug resistant urinary tract infections. It is particularly effective against Gram-negative bacteria, including E. coli, one of the most common pathogens in UTIs.

faq.key: What are the storage requirements for Fosfomycin Trometamol?
faq.value: Fosfomycin Trometamol should be stored in a cool, dry place at temperatures below 30°C (86°F). The product should be kept in its original packaging to protect it from moisture and degradation.

faq.key: Is Fosfomycin Trometamol safe for individuals with kidney disease?
faq.value: People with kidney disease should consult a healthcare provider before using Fosfomycin Trometamol, as dosage adjustments may be necessary based on the severity of kidney dysfunction.

faq.key: How long does it take for Fosfomycin to work in treating a UTI?
faq.value: Many patients experience relief from symptoms of uncomplicated UTIs within 48 hours of taking Fosfomycin Trometamol. However, it is important to complete the prescribed course as directed by the healthcare provider to ensure the infection is fully cleared.

faq.key: What are the side effects of Fosfomycin Trometamol?
faq.value: Common side effects of Fosfomycin Trometamol include diarrhea, headache, and nausea. Serious side effects are rare but can include allergic reactions and gastrointestinal issues. Always follow the prescribed dosage and consult your doctor if you experience any unusual symptoms.

faq.key: Can Fosfomycin be taken by pregnant women?
faq.value: Pregnant women should consult their healthcare provider before taking Fosfomycin Trometamol. It is typically considered safe during pregnancy but should only be used if the potential benefits outweigh the risks.
